creator: a.battistini@regione.toscana.it
text:
Sorry for my bad english but.... Now I'll try to explain the problem....

Running Tomcat 3.3a on Intel Windows 98 I've seen that tomcat doesn't ask the 
browser for client auth. I'm sure I've configured correctly the server.xml.... 
so what's the problem???

Thank you

creator: bojan@binarix.com
text:
It is very difficult to debug problems without detailed information. Please
submit more information (e.g. your configuration files, log files, etc.)

creator: a.battistini@regione.toscana.it
text:
I think I've found the problem!

Tomcat 3.2.4 use clientAuth (with capitalized "A").
Tomcat 3.3a use clientauth (with lowercase "a") but...

in tomcat-ssl-howto.html di tomcat3.3a, chapter "SSL Standalone", paragraph 
3 "Edit the Tomcat configuration file" appears this syntax for tomcat 3.3:

<Http10Connector
    port="8443"
    ....
    clientAuth="false" />

... with capitalized "A" again. So what's wrong: CODE or DOC ???

The SSL document has been updated for the current nightly and will appear
in 3.3.1-rc1
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
